title: Fantasy Bidding with Staked Funds
description: Fans of certain NFT can't bid and win alone. Whales can dominate. Auctions happen all over but not by type. Fans need a 'place' to buy!

f6_assessments.q0: This is an interesting idea, however there seem to be a number of issues. How do you stop the site owner stealing the NFT? What's to stop 1 individual putting 1 ada into every stake pool and then never agreeing to sell any NFT locking out every other buyer from ever selling? If you can partially buy, you should be able to partially sell. This requires a market for the fractional shares.
f6_assessments.q1: No clear technical plan has been presented and the proposer has not provided evidence of the technical experience required to build this. Please provide a plan with time lines on who you would a) build this and b) market it. Please also provide a breakdown of how the funding would achieve these and evidence of ability to deliver (either your own experience or through hiring or joining with others).
f6_assessments.q2: No timeline or detailed plan has been presented so it is not possible to audit progress. Please provide these. Please also define what success is, and set some goals that can be measured against.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement chosen isn't aligned with scaling up of cardano's De-fi but however has good scope for uplifting NFT but the existing auction platforms as mentioned in proposal are already doing collaborative buying of NFTs
f6_assessments.q1: The team consists here are mostly from non technical background however they might end up with good business plan for execution on the same line
f6_assessments.q2: There  is lack of fund distribution details in the proposal and so are missing timeline details however there is good detail about plan of execution, but without the measures it is difficult to evealuate the progress and success.

f6_assessments.q1:
Draft proposal.

There is no implementation plan, just the presentation of an unclear concept related to NFT bidding. I recommend that the proposer look at the Catalyst documentation for proposal creation and look for an appropriate challenge for proposal submission. There is a challenge related to NFTs that may fit, but it is necessary to clarify what the purpose of the proposal is.
There is no budget breakdown or any other detail that can be evaluated to indicate feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no information to allow auditing of the proposal, as the proposal is only a draft. I recommend that the proposer check the information required to allow auditing of the proposal in the Catalyst documentation.
